ObjectAllocator::ObjectAllocator ( size_t  ObjectSize,
const OAConfig &  config 
) throw (OAException)

Destroys the ObjectManager (never throws).

Creates the ObjectManager per the specified values. Throws an exception if the construction fails. (Memory allocation problem).

Parameters:
[in] ObjectSize The size of each object.
[in] config The configuration of the ObjectAllocator

void * ObjectAllocator::Allocate ( const char *  label = 0  )  throw (OAException)

Frees allocated memory.

Take an object from the free list and give it to the client (simulates new) Throws an exception if the object can't be allocated. (Memory allocation problem).

Parameters:
[in] label The label to set for the External header (if it is External Header)
Returns:
The pointer to the allocated memory.

void ObjectAllocator::CheckInFreeList ( GenericObject *  theObj  )  const throw (OAException) [private]

< Check whether the object is in the free list, throw exceptions if it is

Checks whether the object is in the free list, throws exceptions if it is. (Not supposed to be in free list) Does so manually.

Checks the padding of the object, throws exceptions if it is corrupted

Parameters:
[in] theObj The object to check whether it is within the free list

Calls the callback fn for each block still in use.
